The batter's handedness is determined by observing which hand they use to hold the bat. A right-handed player will hold the bat in their left hand and swing it with their right hand. A left-handed player will hold the bat in their right hand and swing it with their left hand.

The batter's handedness is determined by the position of their hands on the bat. A right-handed batter will hold the bat with their left hand on top and their right hand below, while a left-handed batter will hold the bat with their right hand on top and their left hand below.
